meanings.definition: The upper surface of an insect's thorax.
meanings.sent1: The notum of the beetle was shiny and smooth.
meanings.sent2: She gently touched the notum of the ant to study its texture.
meanings.sent3: The ladybug decided to sunbathe on its notum to get a tan.
meanings.sent4: The notum of the grasshopper was like a tiny runway for its wings.
meanings.sent5: The scientist carefully examined the notum of the butterfly under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A raised area on the surface of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The notum on the turtle's shell provided extra protection.
meanings.sent2: The notum on the tree bark felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The cat used the notum on its back as a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The notum on the mountain stood tall against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The notum on the flower petal added a beautiful dimension to its appearance.

meanings.definition: A central part of a flower.
meanings.sent1: The notum of the rose held the delicate petals together.
meanings.sent2: Bees are attracted to the sweet nectar in the notum of the flower.
meanings.sent3: The florist carefully arranged the notum of the lily in the bouquet.
meanings.sent4: The notum of the daisy resembled a tiny golden crown.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops collected in the notum of the sunflower, glistening in the sunlight.
